nanonext 0.9.0.9006
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Set and Retrieve Refhook Function

Source: R/utils.R
refhook.Rd

Sets the refhook function stored internally, used in all message send and receive operations. Calling without an argument retrieves the stored value.

refhook(x = list())

Arguments

x

a function or function encoded by base64enc, or NULL to reset.

Value

The current refhook function stored internally.

Details

The provided function maps to the 'refhook' argument of serialize or unserialize, as the case may be. As the same function is used in both cases, it should contain the logic to distinguish between them as necessary.

Examples

refhook()
#> NULL

func <- function(x) if (is_nano(x)) base64enc(x) else
    if (is.character(x)) unserialize(base64dec(x, convert = FALSE))

refhook(func)
#> function(x) if (is_nano(x)) base64enc(x) else
#>     if (is.character(x)) unserialize(base64dec(x, convert = FALSE))
#> <environment: 0x562feae26ab8>

enc <- base64enc(func)
enc
